--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "cant_jim" <jimcant@...> wrote:
>
> How can=
 I capture the standard output of test? I need to check that
the messages f=
rom the class I'm testing are correct. For example if my
class class calls =
a parser that print "invalid input at line xx" when it
fails, I want to be =
able go catch that output and compare it to the
expected value. If it could=
 be directed to a file on a per-test basis, I
could do a diff to check it.
=
>
> Any suggestions would be appreciated.
>
> Thanks,
>
> Jim Cant
>

You c=
an override the default behavior of System.out.println() using
System.setOu=
t(PrintStream).  Subclass PrintStream and override the print
methods to log=
 to a file that you can specify.  Even better, add a
StringBuilder member w=
ith setter and getter to the PrintStream and
override the print methods to =
append to that.  Your test can do
assertEquals on your expected value and t=
he toString value of the
StringBuilder.  Don't forget to reset the PrintStr=
eam before each test.
